sine_440hz.wav.description: Full-scale 440 Hz sine wave (K-weighted LUFS includes ~0.7 dB attenuation at 440 Hz)

sine_1khz_stereo.wav.description: Full-scale 1 kHz stereo sine wave (metered as stereo per BS.1770-4; two-channel sum gives ~3 dB higher LUFS than mono)

white_noise.wav.description: White noise at -20 dBFS RMS (K-weighting boosts HF energy; true peak well above RMS)

pink_noise.wav.description: Pink noise at -18 dBFS RMS (1/f spectrum; K-weighting effect differs from white noise)

ebu_r128_tone_stereo_23lufs.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 Sec 6.1: Stereo 1 kHz sine at -23 LUFS (EBU R128 reference level). ffmpeg-certified: I=-23.0 LUFS, LRA=0.0 LU, TP=-23.0 dBFS. LUFS and TP match within tolerance; LRA=1.0 is a known pyloudnorm minimum for constant signals (ffmpeg/libebur128 reports 0.0).

ebu_r128_tone_stereo_33lufs.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 Sec 6.2: Stereo 1 kHz sine at -33 LUFS (10 dB below reference, tests metering linearity). ffmpeg-certified: I=-33.0 LUFS, LRA=0.0 LU, TP=-33.0 dBFS. LUFS and TP match within tolerance.

ebu_r128_tone_mono_23lufs.wav.description: BS.1770-4 mono reference: Mono 1 kHz sine at -23 LUFS. Verifies mono channel handling per BS.1770-4. ffmpeg-certified: I=-23.0 LUFS, LRA=0.0 LU, TP=-20.0 dBFS. Higher TP than stereo because mono requires higher amplitude for same LUFS.

ebu_r128_tone_with_silence.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 Sec 7: Stereo 1 kHz at -23 LUFS for 10s + 10s silence. Tests BS.1770-4 absolute gating (silence excluded). ffmpeg-certified: I=-23.0 LUFS, LRA=4.8 LU, TP=-23.0 dBFS. LUFS matches within 0.07 LU; LRA deviation (4.4 vs 4.8) reflects pyloudnorm gating window differences.

ebu_r128_two_tones.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 Sec 8: Two-tone relative gate test. 10s at -36 LUFS then 10s at -23 LUFS. Tests BS.1770-4 relative threshold gating. ffmpeg-certified: I=-23.0 LUFS, LRA=13.0 LU, TP=-23.0 dBFS. LUFS within 0.06 LU; LRA exact match; relative gate correctly excludes quiet segment.

ebu_r128_stereo_997hz_23lufs.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 Seq 1: Stereo 997 Hz sine calibrated to -23.0 LUFS (EBU R128 target level). 997 Hz per ITU-R recommendation (K-weighting near-unity). 20s, 48 kHz, 16-bit. Certified: I=-23.0 LUFS +/-0.1 LU.

ebu_r128_stereo_997hz_33lufs.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 Seq 2: Stereo 997 Hz sine calibrated to -33.0 LUFS (10 dB below reference, tests metering linearity). 20s, 48 kHz, 16-bit. Certified: I=-33.0 LUFS +/-0.1 LU.

ebu_r128_mono_997hz_23lufs.wav.description: ITU-R BS.1770-4 mono reference: 997 Hz sine calibrated to -23.0 LUFS. Verifies single-channel loudness per BS.1770-4. Higher true peak than stereo because mono requires greater amplitude for the same LUFS. 20s, 48 kHz, 16-bit. Certified: I=-23.0 LUFS +/-0.1 LU.

ebu_r128_gate_test.wav.description: EBU Tech 3341 absolute gating test: 10s digital silence followed by 10s stereo 997 Hz tone at -23.0 LUFS. Silence falls below the -70 LUFS absolute gate and must be excluded from integrated measurement. Certified: I=-23.0 LUFS +/-0.1 LU after gating.

ebu_r128_lra_test.wav.description: EBU Tech 3342 Loudness Range test: alternating stereo 997 Hz segments at -20 LUFS and -30 LUFS, 5s each, 6 repetitions (60s total). LRA equals the 95th-to-10th percentile span of short-term loudness. Certified: LRA=10.0 LU +/-0.2 LU. Integrated LUFS is the power-weighted mean of -20/-30 LUFS.
